birth_place.en: Futada Village, Kariwa District, Niigata Prefecture

description.zh-cn: 日本政治人物、建筑师，曾任第64、65任内阁总理大臣。因其平民出身被称为“庶民宰相”，但也因洛克希德事件等丑闻而备受争议。
description.en: Japanese politician and architect who served as the 64th and 65th Prime Minister of Japan. Known as the 'commoner prime minister' for his humble origins, he was also controversial due to scandals like the Lockheed affair.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治人物，第61-63任内阁总理大臣，田中角荣的前任。
description.en: Japanese politician, the 61st-63rd Prime Minister of Japan, and Kakuei Tanaka's predecessor.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治人物，第67任内阁总理大臣，在1972年的自民党总裁选举（角福战争）中被田中角荣击败。
description.en: Japanese politician, the 67th Prime Minister of Japan, who was defeated by Kakuei Tanaka in the 1972 LDP presidential election (Kaku-Fuku War).

description.zh-cn: 日本政治人物，第71-73任内阁总理大臣，曾在1972年支持田中角荣当选自民党总裁。
description.en: Japanese politician, the 71st-73rd Prime Minister of Japan, who supported Kakuei Tanaka in the 1972 LDP presidential election.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治人物，第74任内阁总理大臣，原为田中派成员，后成立创政会和经世会，导致田中派分裂。
description.en: Japanese politician, the 74th Prime Minister of Japan, formerly a member of the Tanaka faction who later formed Sōseikai and Keiseikai, leading to the faction's split.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治人物，战后五度出任内阁总理大臣，曾任命田中角荣为法务省政务次官。
description.en: Japanese politician who served as Prime Minister of Japan five times after the war. He appointed Kakuei Tanaka as Parliamentary Vice-Minister of Justice.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治人物，第56-57任内阁总理大臣，田中角荣曾在其内阁中担任邮政大臣。
description.en: Japanese politician, the 56th-57th Prime Minister of Japan. Kakuei Tanaka served as Minister of Posts in his cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治人物，第58-60任内阁总理大臣，田中角荣曾在其内阁中担任大藏大臣。
description.en: Japanese politician, the 58th-60th Prime Minister of Japan. Kakuei Tanaka served as Minister of Finance in his cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和第一代最高领导人。1972年会见访华的田中角荣。
description.en: A principal founder and the first paramount leader of the People's Republic of China. He met with Kakuei Tanaka during his visit to China in 1972.

description.zh-cn: 美国第37任总统，1973年与田中角荣在白宫会面。
description.en: The 37th President of the United States, who met with Kakuei Tanaka at the White House in 1973.

description.zh-cn: 日本第124代天皇，田中角荣担任首相时的在位天皇。
description.en: The 124th Emperor of Japan, who reigned during Kakuei Tanaka's tenure as Prime Minister.

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣的妻子。
description.en: The wife of Kakuei Tanaka.

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣的长女，日本政治人物。
description.en: Kakuei Tanaka's eldest daughter, also a Japanese politician.

description.zh-cn: 一场涉及美国洛克希德公司向多国政要行贿的跨国丑闻。田中角荣因此案被捕并被判有罪，是其政治生涯的重大污点。
description.en: An international scandal involving bribes from the US aircraft company Lockheed to officials in several countries. Kakuei Tanaka was arrested and convicted in this case, which became a major stain on his political career.

description.zh-cn: 指控田中角荣利用其政治权力建立庞大金权的丑闻，由《文艺春秋》杂志揭发，直接导致其辞去首相职务。
description.en: A scandal alleging that Kakuei Tanaka used his political power to build a vast financial empire, exposed by the magazine Bungeishunjū, which directly led to his resignation as Prime Minister.

description.zh-cn: 1972年日本自由民主党总裁选举中，田中角荣与福田赳夫之间的激烈政治斗争。最终田中获胜并出任首相。
description.en: The intense political struggle between Kakuei Tanaka and Takeo Fukuda for the presidency of the Liberal Democratic Party in 1972. Tanaka ultimately won and became Prime Minister.

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣在1985年突发脑梗塞，导致其出现语言和行动障碍，被迫从政界引退。
description.en: Kakuei Tanaka suffered a cerebral infarction in 1985, which resulted in speech and mobility impairments, forcing him to retire from politics.

description.zh-cn: 日本的主要政党，田中角荣长期担任其重要领导人，并曾任总裁。
description.en: A major political party in Japan, where Kakuei Tanaka was a key leader and served as its president.

description.zh-cn: 日本自由民主党内由田中角荣领导的派系，在1980年代是党内最大派系，后因竹下登等人另立门户而分裂。
description.en: The faction within Japan's Liberal Democratic Party led by Kakuei Tanaka. It was the largest faction in the 1980s but later split when members like Noboru Takeshita formed their own group.

description.zh-cn: 由竹下登在田中派内部成立的次级派系，此举标志着田中派分裂的开始。
description.en: A sub-faction formed within the Tanaka faction by Noboru Takeshita, an act that marked the beginning of the Tanaka faction's split.

description.zh-cn: 日本杂志社。其刊物于1974年揭发了田中金脉问题，导致田中角荣下台。
description.en: A Japanese magazine publisher. Its publication exposed the Tanaka financial scandal in 1974, leading to Kakuei Tanaka's resignation.

description.zh-cn: 日本的法院。1983年，该法院因洛克希德事件判处田中角荣四年徒刑。
description.en: A court in Japan. In 1983, it sentenced Kakuei Tanaka to four years in prison for his role in the Lockheed scandal.

description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的国家。田中角荣于1972年访问中国，并与之建立了外交关系。
description.en: A country in East Asia. Kakuei Tanaka visited China in 1972 and established diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣在1972年与中华人民共和国建交的同时，与中华民国断绝了外交关系。
description.en: Kakuei Tanaka severed diplomatic relations with the Republic of China in 1972 upon establishing relations with the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 指1972年日本与中华人民共和国建立正式外交关系的历史进程，由田中角荣首相任内实现。
description.en: Refers to the historical process of establishing formal diplomatic relations between Japan and the People's Republic of China in 1972, achieved during Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka's term.

en: Joint Communiqué of the Government of Japan and the Government of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 1972年由田中角荣和中方领导人签署的文件，标志着中日邦交正常化的实现。
description.en: The document signed by Kakuei Tanaka and Chinese leaders in 1972, marking the normalization of relations between Japan and China.

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣于1972年出版的著作，提出了通过大规模公共投资和工业重新布局来解决城乡发展不均等问题的政策构想。
description.en: A book published by Kakuei Tanaka in 1972, outlining a policy vision to address regional disparities through large-scale public investment and industrial relocation.

description.zh-cn: 1948年，田中角荣发表演讲支持吉田茂连任总裁，随后被吉田茂任命为法务省政务次官。
description.en: In 1948, Kakuei Tanaka gave a speech supporting Shigeru Yoshida's re-election as party president and was subsequently appointed by Yoshida as Parliamentary Vice-Minister of Justice.

description.zh-cn: 在岸信介内阁中担任邮政大臣。
description.en: Served as Minister of Posts in the cabinet of Nobusuke Kishi.

description.zh-cn: 在池田勇人内阁中担任大藏大臣。
description.en: Served as Minister of Finance in the cabinet of Hayato Ikeda.

position.zh-cn: 大藏大臣、通商产业大臣
position.en: Minister of Finance, Minister of International Trade and Industry

description.zh-cn: 在佐藤荣作内阁中先后担任大藏大臣和通商产业大臣。
description.en: Served successively as Minister of Finance and Minister of International Trade and Industry in the cabinet of Eisaku Satō.

position.zh-cn: 总裁、干事长、政务调查会长
position.en: President, Secretary-General, Chairman of the Policy Research Council

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣长期是自由民主党的核心成员，并曾担任党总裁等最高职务，后因洛克希德事件退党。
description.en: Kakuei Tanaka was a core member of the LDP for many years, holding top positions including Party President, but left the party due to the Lockheed scandal.

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣在1972年的自民党总裁选举（角福战争）中，通过拉拢中曾根康弘等小派系，成功击败福田赳夫，当选总裁并成为首相。
description.en: In the 1972 LDP presidential election (Kaku-Fuku War), Kakuei Tanaka defeated Takeo Fukuda by aligning with smaller factions like Yasuhiro Nakasone's, securing the presidency and thus the premiership.

description.zh-cn: 福田赳夫在1972年的自民党总裁选举（角福战争）中败于田中角荣。
description.en: Takeo Fukuda was defeated by Kakuei Tanaka in the 1972 LDP presidential election (Kaku-Fuku War).

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣就任首相仅两个月后便访问中华人民共和国，签署了《中日联合声明》，实现了两国邦交正常化。
description.en: Just two months after taking office as Prime Minister, Kakuei Tanaka visited the People's Republic of China and signed the Joint Communiqué, normalizing diplomatic relations between the two countries.

description.zh-cn: 该声明的签署标志着中华人民共和国与日本国之间外交关系的正式建立。
description.en: The signing of this communiqué marked the official establishment of diplomatic relations between the People's Republic of China and Japan.

description.zh-cn: 随着与中华人民共和国建交，田中角荣政府宣布与中华民国断绝外交关系。
description.en: Upon establishing diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China, the Kakuei Tanaka government announced the severance of diplomatic relations with the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 1972年9月27日，作为日本首相的田中角荣在北京与时任中共中央主席毛泽东举行了会谈。
description.en: On September 27, 1972, Japanese Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka held talks with CPC Chairman Mao Zedong in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 1973年，田中角荣在美国白宫与时任美国总统理查·尼克森会面。
description.en: In 1973, Kakuei Tanaka met with then-US President Richard Nixon at the White House.

description.zh-cn: 1974年，《文艺春秋》杂志刊文揭露田中角荣的金权问题，直接引发了“田中金脉问题”丑闻，并导致其辞去首相职务。
description.en: In 1974, the magazine Bungeishunjū published an article exposing Kakuei Tanaka's financial dealings, directly triggering the 'Tanaka Kinmyaku Mondai' scandal and leading to his resignation as Prime Minister.

description.zh-cn: 该丑闻的爆发迫使田中角荣于1974年12月宣布内阁总辞职。
description.en: The outbreak of this scandal forced Kakuei Tanaka to announce the resignation of his entire cabinet in December 1974.

description.zh-cn: 因被揭发在洛克希德事件中收受贿赂，田中角荣于1976年被捕，其政治生涯和声誉遭受重创。
description.en: After being exposed for accepting bribes in the Lockheed scandal, Kakuei Tanaka was arrested in 1976, causing severe damage to his political career and reputation.

description.zh-cn: 1983年，东京地方法院因洛克希德事件一审判处田中角荣4年徒刑。
description.en: In 1983, the Tokyo District Court sentenced Kakuei Tanaka to 4 years in prison in the first trial of the Lockheed scandal.

description.zh-cn: 1985年，田中派内的竹下登成立了学习会“创政会”，后发展为经世会，此举导致了田中派（木曜俱乐部）的分裂。
description.en: In 1985, Noboru Takeshita of the Tanaka faction formed the study group 'Sōseikai', which later evolved into Keiseikai. This move led to the split of the Tanaka faction (Mokuyō Club).

description.zh-cn: 竹下登于1985年2月7日在田中派内部成立了“创政会”，为日后脱离田中派独立打下基础。
description.en: Noboru Takeshita founded 'Sōseikai' within the Tanaka faction on February 7, 1985, laying the groundwork for his eventual split from the faction.

description.zh-cn: 1985年2月，田中角荣因突发脑梗塞导致身体和语言功能障碍，从此无法参与政治活动，被迫引退。
description.en: In February 1985, Kakuei Tanaka suffered a cerebral infarction that caused physical and speech impairments, preventing him from participating in political activities and forcing his retirement.

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣撰写并出版了《日本列岛改造论》，以此作为其内政的主要方针。
description.en: Kakuei Tanaka authored and published 'Building a New Japan' ('Nihon Rettō Kaizōron') as the main guideline for his domestic policy.

description.zh-cn: 田中真纪子是田中角荣的嫡长女。
description.en: Makiko Tanaka is the eldest daughter of Kakuei Tanaka.

description.zh-cn: 田中角荣于1942年与田中花结婚。
description.en: Kakuei Tanaka married Hana Tanaka in 1942.
